meanings.definition: A married woman, especially one who is mature and dignified.
meanings.sent1: The matrons in the neighborhood always gathered for tea and gossip.
meanings.sent2: The matrons of the village were respected for their wisdom and kindness.
meanings.sent3: The matrons at the bake sale were like queens overseeing their kingdom of pastries.
meanings.sent4: The matrons of the community stood tall like ancient trees, providing shade and comfort to all.
meanings.sent5: The image of the matrons in their elegant dresses was etched in the memories of the townspeople.

meanings.definition: A woman in charge of domestic and medical arrangements at an institution.
meanings.sent1: The matrons at the hospital ensured that everything ran smoothly for the patients.
meanings.sent2: The matrons of the orphanage were like mothers to all the children under their care.
meanings.sent3: The matrons organizing the charity event were like conductors orchestrating a symphony of generosity.
meanings.sent4: The matrons of the nursing home were the pillars of strength and compassion for the residents.
meanings.sent5: The matrons overseeing the kitchen worked tirelessly to provide nutritious meals for everyone.

meanings.definition: A woman serving as a guardian or protector.
meanings.sent1: The matrons of the castle kept a watchful eye on the young princess.
meanings.sent2: The matrons of the village were known for their fierce loyalty and unwavering courage.
meanings.sent3: The matrons guarding the ancient artifact were like fierce warriors protecting their treasure.
meanings.sent4: The matrons of the forest guided travelers safely through the enchanted woods.
meanings.sent5: The matrons of the sanctuary shielded the endangered animals from harm.
